column5: Nice to see the pins getting a work out!  With the tough river conditions this spring Bill, I didnt get to use the pin around here much. Was nice to get it back in my hands.
Awesome pix!  Thanx
We got bent well today. Thats all I have to say about that.
it was a good opener
Those simcoe Lakers are so greasy you need a bounce sheet to grab onto them??  Great fish, even a bonus whitey too by the looks of it
Great day guys,as said a Whitey thrown in.WTG,Water looked calm, added bonus !!!!!!!!!!
sweet! That's a boat load of slime there - and no bugs this time! hoping to try for some of the same down here tomorrow, if the wind holds off.
sweet! That's a boat load of slime there - and no bugs this time! hoping to try for some of the same down here tomorrow, if the wind holds off.   Rick, ah ya, there was,,,,,,,,,,,,
Oh man that's awesome! Never caught an open water laker, will have to remedy that this year. Well done fellas.
Oh man that's awesome! Never caught an open water laker, will have to remedy that this year. Well done fellas.  You have my number pal.
Nice I let the walleye guys have their fun, and went for drop backs today, seen lots of boat heading to Rice
Nice work, looks like you had a spectacular day.
Good fish there guys! See the pin is still going strong

Wow! Quite the day.I guess my buddy Ralph must have missed a few last winter!1  For some reason reminds me of that old limerick:  There was a young man from Kent whose rod was severely bent So, to save himself trouble he shoved it in double and instead of coming, he went!!  You're not from Kent, are you??
WOW…stunning pics!  Great day out!
Wow, well done boys!!  I hate those little gnats - ugh!!!
Thanks gang.  Good fish there guys! See the pin is still going strong  Chris, I dont think I can go back to a drag system. I like the challange.
You better get to that rod in a hurry if a big fish hits!
You better get to that rod in a hurry if a big fish hits!  Been using it the last two seasons. The 13.5 rod gives me a few seconds to react.LOL
Really nice Brian. Must be nice fighting fish in that deep of a water ☺. Your rubber band system is genius .  13.5' rod plus rubber band= lotsa time, tome to react ☺

Really nice Brian. Must be nice fighting fish in that deep of a water ☺. Your rubber band system is genius . 13.5' rod plus rubber band= lotsa time, tome to react ☺  A couple of guys that are/were, members here do it. I just went with what they told me and havent looked back. They used rubber bands, (thats what I started with, til I had one break and thought I had the holly of holly strikes. Line was every where.LOL). Thought, why not use one of the hair bands I have from the mrs,s to tie the rods together. I  thought the mrs,s wouldnt mis a few of them, til I was asked why I had them on my rod..LOL
Ha ha. Busted!
Nice haul Gents.
Great day on a fabulous fishery....
Awesome fish.. great pics! Very jealous... good work guys!
Great report and pics!!  Not a bad opener at all.
Nice to see the pins getting a work out!
